Canine DUXC: Implications for DUX4 retrotransposition and preclinical models of FSHD Preface 0.1 Datasets 0.2 Tips

Canine DUXC: Implications for DUX4 retrotransposition and preclinical models of FSHD Chao-Jen Wong Preface We wrote this book to support the reproducibility and transparancy of the computational work for our manuscript, Canine DUXC: Implications for DUX4 retrotransposition and preclinical models of FSHD[insert line here]. This book is built by R markdown, knitr (Xie 2019), and bookdown (Xie 2016) R packages. It presents the workflow and reproducible codes of our Bioinformatics analysis on the RNA-seq and ChIP-seq data, which are available in our github repos. All the figures and tables here in the book are genereated on the fly of the code. The The processed R-compatible datasets for all human DUX4 (GSE85461), mouse Dux (GSE87282) and canine DUXC models (GSEXXXXX), both ChIP-seq and RNA-seq, are available in our github repos. 0.1 Datasets The datasets are located in the /data folder in the repos. It includes the results of ChIP-seq (peaks) andprocessed RNA-seq datasets, all of which were in R/Bioconductor compatible format. The datasets include: 1. read counts and DESeq2 results (DESeqDataSet) randered from RNA-seq of the human DUX4, mouse Dux and canine DUXC transcription factor models 2. repeat analysis results 3. peaks called from ChIP-seq 4. miscellaneous data.frame collected from other publications that were used for our analysis \data ├── C2C12.ens.ddsl2.rda: Dux and DUX4 transcriptome in mouse myoblast cell lines ├── CALTinC.ens.dds.rda: DUXC-ALT transcriptome in canine skeletal muscle ├── CALTinC_rmsk.rda: repeat element expression in DUXC-ALT transcriptome ├── CinC.ens.dds.rda: DUXC transcriptome ├── CinC_rmsk.rda: DUXC repeat element expression ├── HinC.ens.dds.rda: DUX4 transcriptome in canine skeletal muscle ├── HinC_rmsk.rda: repeat element expression in HinC transcriptome ├── HinH.ens.dds.rda: DUX4 transcriptome in human myoblast ├── HinH_rmsk.rda: repeat element expression in HinH transcriptome ├── canine.repName.SE.rda: repeat element expression in CinC transcriptome (don't need it) ├── human_cleavage.rda: Hendrikson 2017 zygotic activation gene set [ref] ├── peaks_list.rda: peaks called by ChIP-seq ├── rmsk.dds.rda: repeat element expression in CinC transcriptome ├── rmsk.res.rda └── z4_ensembl.rda: Akiyama 2015 2C-like gene set from [ref] 0.2 Tips How to use AnnotationHub to access the GTF file and build a TxDb (transcript database) annotation package on the fly # example: library(AnnotationHub) ah = AnnotationHub() query(ah, c("canFam3", "ensembl")) gr <- ah["AH79003"] ## download Canis_familiaris ensembl version 99 ## (1) build on the fly txdb <- makeTxDbFromGRanges(gr) ## build on the fly ## (2) build a package md <- data.frame(name=c("ensembl_version", "Data source", "Organism", "Resource URL", "Type of Gene ID"), value=c("canFam3.1.99", "AnnotationHub query AH79003", "Canis familiaris ", "http://ensembl.org", "Ensembl Gene ID")) txdb <- makeTxDbFromGRanges(gr, metadata=md) makeTxDbPackage(txdb=txdb, version="1.0.0", pkgname="TxDb.Cfamiliaris.CanFam3.ensGene.v99", maintainer="Chao-Jen Wong <cwon2@fredhutch.org>", author="Chao-Jen Wong", destDir="~/tapscott/canfam3") # References
